title: Cornell Assessment of Pediatric Delirium (CAPD)
desc: The Cornell Assessment of Pediatric Delirium (CAPD) screens for pediatric delirium.

orgreference.text: Traube C, Silver G, Kearney J, et al. Cornell Assessment of Pediatric Delirium: a valid, rapid, observational tool for screening delirium in the PICU*. Crit Care Med. 2014;42(3):656-63.

other_refer.text: Daoud A, Duff JP, Joffe AR. Diagnostic accuracy of delirium diagnosis in pediatric intensive care: a systematic review. Crit Care. 2014;18(5):489.

data.evidence:
Addition of the selected points, based on interactions with the patient over the course of one nursing shift. Note that the "best" scores (i.e., associated with absence of delirium) are listed first, e.g. Makes eye contact - always (0 points), Inconsolable - never (0 points).

Refer to Fig 2 in Silver 2015 for developmental anchor points based on age.
data.facts:
Interpretation:

CAPD Score

Delirium

Recommendation

≥9

Present

Investigate and treat underlying medical condition(s) causing delirium, consider interventions with parents and child life services, and/or consult to psychiatry or palliative care as appropriate, consider medications like melatonin or QUEtiapine (SEROquel) in select cases

<9

Absent

Continue usual care and monitoring

inputs.name: age
inputs.tips_en: Select closest

inputs.subheading: Assess patient based on interactions over one nursing shift:

inputs.name: eye1
inputs.tips_en: Fixates on face

inputs.name: purpose1
inputs.tips_en: Moves head to side, dominated by primitive reflexes

inputs.name: aware1
inputs.tips_en: Calm awake time

inputs.name: communication1
inputs.tips_en: Cries when hungry or uncomfortable

inputs.name: restless1
inputs.tips_en: No sustained awake alert state

inputs.name: incon1
inputs.tips_en: Not soothed by parental rocking, singing, feeding, comforting actions

inputs.name: under1
inputs.tips_en: Little if any flexed and then relaxed state with primitive reflexes   (child should be sleeping comfortably most of the time)

inputs.label_en: Takes long time to respond to interactions
inputs.name: time1
inputs.tips_en: Not making sounds or reflexes active as expected (grasp, suck, moro)

inputs.name: eye2
inputs.tips_en: Holds gaze briefly, follows 90°

inputs.name: purpose2
inputs.tips_en: Reaches (with some discoordination)

inputs.name: aware2
inputs.tips_en: Awake alert time, turns to primary caretaker’s voice, may turn to smell of primary caretaker

inputs.name: communication2
inputs.tips_en: Cries when hungry or uncomfortable

inputs.name: restless2
inputs.tips_en: No sustained calm state

inputs.name: incon2
inputs.tips_en: Not soothed by parental rocking, singing, feeding, comforting actions

inputs.name: under2
inputs.tips_en: Little if any reaching, kicking, grasping (still may be somewhat discoordinated)

inputs.label_en: Takes long time to respond to interactions
inputs.name: time2
inputs.tips_en: Not making sounds or reflexes active as expected (grasp, suck, moro)

inputs.name: eye3
inputs.tips_en: Holds gaze

inputs.name: purpose3
inputs.tips_en: Reaches

inputs.name: aware3
inputs.tips_en: Increasing awake alert time, turns to primary caretaker’s voice, may turn to smell of primary caretaker

inputs.name: communication3
inputs.tips_en: Cries when hungry or uncomfortable

inputs.name: restless3
inputs.tips_en: No sustained calm state

inputs.name: incon3
inputs.tips_en: Not soothed by parental rocking, singing, feeding, comforting actions

inputs.name: under3
inputs.tips_en: Little if any reaching, kicking, grasping (may begin to be more coordinated)

inputs.label_en: Takes long time to respond to interactions
inputs.name: time3
inputs.tips_en: Not kicking or crying with noxious stimuli

inputs.name: eye4
inputs.tips_en: Follows moving object/caregiver past midline, regards examiner’s hand holding object, focused attention

inputs.name: purpose4
inputs.tips_en: Symmetric movements, will passively grasp handed object

inputs.name: aware4
inputs.tips_en: Facial brightening or smile in response to nodding head, frown to bell, coos

inputs.name: communication4
inputs.tips_en: Cries when hungry or uncomfortable

inputs.name: restless4
inputs.tips_en: No sustained calm state

inputs.name: incon4
inputs.tips_en: Not soothed by parental rocking, singing, feeding, comforting actions

inputs.name: under4
inputs.tips_en: Little if any purposive grasping, control of head and arm movements, such as pushing things that are noxious away

inputs.label_en: Takes long time to respond to interactions
inputs.name: time4
inputs.tips_en: Not cooing, smiling, or focusing gaze in response to interactions

inputs.name: eye5
inputs.tips_en: Holds gaze, prefers primary parent, looks at speaker

inputs.name: purpose5
inputs.tips_en: Reaches with coordinated smooth movement

inputs.name: aware5
inputs.tips_en: Strongly prefers mother, then other familiars, differentiates between novel and familiar objects

inputs.name: communication5
inputs.tips_en: Vocalizes/indicates about needs, e.g. hunger, discomfort, curiosity in objects, or surroundings

inputs.name: restless5
inputs.tips_en: No sustained calm state

inputs.name: incon5
inputs.tips_en: Not soothed by usual methods, e.g. singing, holding, talking

inputs.name: under5
inputs.tips_en: Little if any reaching, grasping, moving around in bed, pushing things away

inputs.label_en: Takes long time to respond to interactions
inputs.name: time5
inputs.tips_en: Not babbling or smiling/laughing in social interactions (or even actively rejecting an interaction)

inputs.name: eye6
inputs.tips_en: Holds gaze, prefers primary parent, looks at speaker

inputs.name: purpose6
inputs.tips_en: Reaches and manipulates objects, tries to change position, if mobile, may try to get up

inputs.name: aware6
inputs.tips_en: Prefers primary parent, then other familiars, upset when separated from preferred caretakers, comforted by familiar objects especially favorite blanket or stuffed animal

inputs.name: communication6
inputs.tips_en: Uses single words, or signs

inputs.name: restless6
inputs.tips_en: No sustained calm state

inputs.name: incon6
inputs.tips_en: Not soothed by usual methods, e.g. singing, holding, talking, reading

inputs.name: under6
inputs.tips_en: Little if any play, efforts to sit up, pull up, and if mobile, crawl or walk around

inputs.label_en: Takes long time to respond to interactions
inputs.name: time6
inputs.tips_en: Not following simple directions, if verbal, not engaging in simple dialogue with words or jargon

inputs.name: eye7
inputs.tips_en: Holds gaze, prefers primary parent, looks at speaker

inputs.name: purpose7
inputs.tips_en: Reaches and manipulates objects, tries to change position, if mobile, may try to get up and walk

inputs.name: aware7
inputs.tips_en: Prefers primary parent, then other familiars, upset when separated from preferred care takers, comforted by familiar objects especially favorite blanket or stuffed animal

inputs.name: communication7
inputs.tips_en: Uses 3-4 word sentences, or signs, may indicate toilet needs, calls self or me

inputs.name: restless7
inputs.tips_en: No sustained calm state

inputs.name: incon7
inputs.tips_en: Not soothed by usual methods, e.g. singing, holding, talking, reading (may tantrum, but can organize)

inputs.name: under7
inputs.tips_en: Little if any more elaborate play, efforts to sit up and move around, and if able to stand, walk or jump

inputs.label_en: Takes long time to respond to interactions
inputs.name: time7
inputs.tips_en: Not following  1-2 step simple commands, if verbal, not engaging in more complex dialogue
